Package tsi.too.io

Class InputDialog

java.lang.Object
tsi.too.io.InputDialog
public abstract class InputDialog
extends java.lang.Object
A simple class for user's input handling.
Version:
0.1
Author:
Lucas Cristovam

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static interface  InputDialog.Executor<E>
    A processor for executing an action based on an object.
    static interface  InputDialog.InputValidator<E>
    A processor that checks an input.
    static class  InputDialog.MultiLineDimension
    Represents the multiLine dialog dimensions.

  • Method Details

    • showIntegerInputDialog

      public static java.lang.Integer showIntegerInputDialog​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, InputDialog.InputValidator<java.lang.Integer> validator)
      Shows a dialog requesting input from the user. Loops until the validation rule is satisfied or the user cancels the reading.
      Parameters:
      title - the Object to display in the dialog title bar.
      message - the Object to display.
      validator - the Object with the validation rule.
      Returns:
      user's input parsed or null if aborted.
      Since:
      0.1

    • showMaskedInputDialog

      public static java.lang.String showMaskedInputDialog​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, java.lang.String mask, InputDialog.InputValidator<java.lang.String> validator)
      Shows a dialog box asking for user input with the specified mask. Loops until the validation rule is satisfied or the user cancels the reading.
      Parameters:
      title - the Object to display in the dialog title bar.
      message - the Object to display.
      mask - the mask to use.
      validator - the Object with validation rule.
      Returns:
      user's input parsed or null if canceled.
      Since:
      0.1

    • showMultiLineInputDialog

      public static java.lang.String showMultiLineInputDialog​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, InputDialog.MultiLineDimension dimension)
      Shows a multiLine input dialog
      Parameters:
      title - the Object to display in the dialog title bar.
      message - the Object to display.
      dimension - the preferred dialog dimension.
      Returns:
      user's input.
      Since:
      0.1

    • showOptionDialog

      public static <E> E showOptionDialog​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, E[] options)
      Brings up a choice dialog, where the initial choice is the first one.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of the options.
      Parameters:
      title - the title string for the dialog.
      message - the message to display.
      options - the available choices.
      Returns:
      user's choice or null if canceled.
      Since:
      0.1

    • showMenuDialog

      public static void showMenuDialog​(java.lang.String title, java.lang.String message, java.util.List<java.lang.String> options, java.lang.String exitOption, InputDialog.Executor<java.lang.String> executor)
      Brings up a choice dialog, where the initial choice is the first one and executes an action based on the selected option. If the user closes the dialog, no action is taken.
      Parameters:
      title - the title string for the dialog.
      message - the message to display.
      options - the available choices.
      exitOption - the default loop cancel option.
      executor - the executor to the selected option.
      Since:
      0.1

    • createEmptyStringValidator

      public static final InputDialog.InputValidator<java.lang.String> createEmptyStringValidator​(java.lang.String message)
      Creates an default InputDialog.InputValidator for empty strings.
      Parameters:
      message - the message to return if validation fails.
      Returns:
      the created InputDialog.InputValidator.
      Since:
      0.1

    • createRangeValidator

      public static final InputDialog.InputValidator<java.lang.Double> createRangeValidator​(double beginInclusive, double endInclusive, java.lang.String validationMessage)
      Creates a double range InputDialog.InputValidator
      Parameters:
      beginInclusive - the first element of the range.
      endInclusive - the last element of the range.
      validationMessage - the message to return if validation fails.
      Returns:
      a InputDialog.InputValidator for Double range values.
      Since:
      0.1
